Jhon Travolta Kunjungi Museum Pesawat Yang Akan Tampung Boeing 707 Miliknya Di NSW
04 Nov 2019, 14:19 by ABC
Bintang Hollywood John Travolta mengunjungi museum pesawat regional di Albion Park, New South Wales di mana ia akan menyumbangkan pesawat Boeing 707 miliknya.
Aktor Jhon Travolta yang juga berprofesi sebagai pilot dan duta besar Qantas mengumumkan ia sedianya akan menerbangkan sendiri pesawat yang akan didonasikannya itu ke Historical Aircraft Restoration Society (HARS) pada November tahun ini, tetapi rencana itu terbentur masalah pendanaan, teknik, dan izin penerbangan.
Sebagai gantinya, bintang film Hollywood ini meluangkan waktu pada hari ini, Senin (4/11/2019) untuk memeriksa fasilitas yang akan menampung pesawat miliknya dan menerbangkan salah satu pesawat ikonik yang paling terkenal milik museum itu, Lockheed C-121C Super Constellation, atau 'Connie'.
"Luar biasa sekali bagi anggota HARS berkesempatan berbincang dengan John Travolta, beberapa di antaranya mengenalnya dengan baik," kata presiden HARS, La La Hunty.
"HARS telah melakukan banyak pekerjaan untuk memulihkan Boeing 707 yang telah disumbangkan John ke museum penerbangan kami [dan] dan pekerjaan itu terus berlanjut.


Aktor John Travolta di kokpit pesawat Boeing 707 miliknya yang akan disumbangkan ke HARS. Reuters: Fred Prouser

"Masih diperlukan waktu Lebih banyak untuk memenuhi persyaratan dari Otoritas Penerbangan Sipil Australia (CASA) dan Administrasi Penerbangan Federal Negara Bagian (FAA).
"Meski sangat disayangkan karena keadaan di luar kendali kami, pesawat Boeing 707 itu tidak bisa tiba bersama dengan Jhon Travolta, tapi kami merasa terhormat dapat menyambutnya dan berharap dapat menemaninya berkeliling melihat museum kami."
Jhon Travolta saat ini berada di Australia sebagai bagian dari tur program talkshownya bertajuk An Evening With John Travolta yang tampil di Sydney pada Rabu (6/11/2019) malam.
Sore ini menurut recana dia akan bertemu dengan sukarelawan dari HARS, sponsor relokasi pesawatnya, dan memeriksa museum.


Insinyur Frank Bowden dan Peter Elliott dari HARS memeriksa Boeing 707 John Travolta di Bandara Brunswick Golden Isles di Georgia. Supplied: Andy Zakeli / Bendigo Bank

Pesawat dijadwalkan tiba bulan ini
Keluarga besar museum HARS sangat bergembira sejak diumumkan pada bulan Juni lalu bahwa Boeing 707 milik John Travolta akan tiba pada November ini.
Pada saat itu, Bob De La Hunty mengumumkan otoritas penerbangan akan menerbitkan semacam izin khusus untuk memungkinkan pesawat tersebut diterbangkan dari Amerika Serikat ke rumah barunya di Illawarra.
Sementara HARS masih menantikan pengiriman pesawat mewah itu, kunjungan oleh mantan pemiliknya yang terkenal telah disambut oleh Walikota Shellharbour Marianne Saliba.
"Meski Jhon Travolta tiba tanpa pesawat Boeing 707 miliknya yang akan disumbangkan ke HARS, kami sangat Bahagia Jhon telah meluangkan waktu dalam jadwalnya untuk mengunjungi dan melihat dari dekat di mana pesawatnya akan ditempatkan setelah tiba di Bandara Shellharbour," katanya. kata.
Marriane Saliba mengatakan dewan juga siap menyambut pesawat milik Jhon Travolta ke Albion Park dan telah mengatur rencana untuk mengantisipasi kerumunan massa ketika pesawat itu tiba.
"Dewan kota belum mengetahui pasti terkait kunjungan Jhon Travolta, begitu juga dengan kedatangan pesawat maupun ketersediaannya, tetapi kami telah berhubungan dengan HARS tentang keselamatan publik - terutama mengenai jalan di dalam dan sekitar bandara," kata Saliba.
"Keamanan publik adalah prioritas nomor satu kami."


John Travolta berbicara pada awak media di bandara Shellharbour usai menerbangkan pesawat Connie aircraft. ABC Illawarra: Justin Huntsdale

Di Bandara Shellharbour, Travolta menjelaskan alasan mengapa dia bersedia menyumbangkan pesawat Boeing 707 miliknya ke HARS.
"Pesawat ini [the Connie] adalah bagian dari sejarah penerbangan saya dan HARS satu-satunya orang di dunia yang bersedia mempertahankannya. Saya pernah memilikinya satu tahun yang lalu," katanya.
"Ini adalah museum yang menjaga pesawat terbang tetap dapat dioperasikan. Koleksi pesawat yang tidak dioperasikan memang tetap indah, tetapi tidak semenantang menjaga pesawat terbang bersejarah yang penting itu tetap dapat dioperasikan.
Diterbitkan ulang dari artikel berbahasa Inggris disini.

Jhon Travolta Visits The Aircraft Museum That Will Hold His Boeing 707 In NSW
Nov 04 2019, 14:19 by ABC
Hollywood star John Travolta visits the regional airplane museum in Albion Park, New South Wales where he will donate his Boeing 707.
Actor Jhon Travolta who also works as a pilot and ambassador Qantas announced he was originally going to fly the plane to donate to the Historical Aircraft Restoration Society (HARS) in November this year, but the plan was hampered by funding, engineering and flight permit issues.
Instead, the Hollywood movie star takes the time today, Monday (11/04/2019) to check the facilities that will accommodate his aircraft and fly one of the museum's most famous iconic planes, the Lockheed C-121C Super Constellation, or 'Connie'.
"It's extraordinary for HARS members to have the opportunity to talk with John Travolta, some of whom know him well," said HARS president La La Hunty.
"HARS has done a lot of work to restore the Boeing 707 that John donated to our aviation museum [and] and the work continues.


Actor John Travolta in the cockpit of his Boeing 707 will be donated to the HARS. Reuters: Fred Prouser

"More time is still needed to meet the requirements of the Australian Civil Aviation Authority (CASA) and the State Federal Aviation Administration (FAA).
"Although it is unfortunate because the circumstances are out of our control, the Boeing 707 could not arrive together with Jhon Travolta, but we are honored to welcome him and hope to accompany him around to see our museum."
Jhon Travolta is currently in Australia as part of his talkshow program tour titled An Evening With John Travolta who performed in Sydney on Wednesday (11/06/2019) night.
This afternoon according to plan he will meet with volunteers from HARS, sponsor the relocation of his plane, and inspect the museum.


Engineers Frank Bowden and Peter Elliott of HARS examined Boeing 707 John Travolta at Brunswick Golden Isles Airport in Georgia. Supplied: Andy Zakeli / Bendigo Bank

The plane is scheduled to arrive this month
The HARS museum family has been very happy since it was announced last June that John Travolta's Boeing 707 will arrive this November.
At that time, Bob De La Hunty announced that the aviation authority would issue a special permit to allow the aircraft to be flown from the United States to his new home in Illawarra.
While HARS is still waiting for the delivery of the luxury aircraft, a visit by its famous former owner has been welcomed by Shellharbour Mayor Marianne Saliba.
"Although Jhon Travolta arrived without his Boeing 707 to be donated to HARS, we are very happy that Jhon has taken the time in his schedule to visit and look closely at where his plane will be placed after arriving at Shellharbour Airport," he said. the word.
Marriane Saliba said the council was also ready to welcome Jhon Travolta's plane to Albion Park and had arranged plans to anticipate the crowd when the plane arrived.
"The city council is not sure about Jhon Travolta's visit, nor is the arrival of the aircraft and its availability, but we have dealt with HARS about public safety - especially regarding roads in and around the airport," Saliba said.
"Public safety is our number one priority."


John Travolta spoke to media crews at Shellharbour airport after flying Connie aircraft. ABC Illawarra: Justin Huntsdale

At Shellharbour Airport, Travolta explained the reason why he was willing to donate his Boeing 707 to HARS.
"This aircraft [the Connie] is part of my aviation history and HARS is the only person in the world who is willing to defend it. I once owned it a year ago," he said.
"This is a museum that keeps airplanes operational. Collection of non-operated aircraft is still beautiful, but it is not as challenging as keeping that important historic aircraft operational.
